nodes.bodyText:
Don't catch the command syntax exception. Let brigadier handle it (you can make the method throw it and be fine).
Reason being the command manager will return a richer message when you attempt to get the ServerPlayerEntity if you are running as a server and fail for you.
I think we should move this up to be in alphabetical order like how all the other modules appear

I don't think these files should be in the minecraft namespace?
Shouldn't this be located at src/testmod/resources/data/testrmod/dimension/fabric_dimension/void.json

It's a quirk of the system.

Unlike other data pack contents, dimensions only function in the minecraft namespace, and require a sub folder which is treated as the namespace. For example data/minecraft/dimension/custom/test.json will be called with custom:test.

https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Dimension#Dimension_syntax
ah okay so this is a special case
Yes.. this confused me at first, almost seems like a vanilla bug IMO.
how about something like DimensionTeleportHandler or just TeleportHandler? EntityPlacer is very vague and it leads to vague class names in user code
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -23,16 +23,18 @@
 
 /**
  * Responsible for placing an Entity once they have entered a dimension.
- * Stored by a FabricDimensionType, and used in Entity::changeDimension.
+ * used in Entity::changeDimension.
+ *
+ * @deprecated Experimental feature, may be removed or changed without further notice due to potential changes to Dimensions in subsequent versions.
  *
  * @see FabricDimensions
- * @see FabricDimensionType
  */
+@Deprecated
 @FunctionalInterface
 public interface EntityPlacer {

nodes.bodyText: This doesnt actually have anything to do with the teleportation. Its just handling the spawn (location, and possibly portal creation) of the entity in the other world.

nodes.bodyText:
For me, EntityPlacer can be anything related to entity spawning, entities summoning other entities for attack etc
TeleportationSomething is significantly clearer.
Anything that mentions "teleport" or "teleportation" will be better than that

nodes.bodyText: Example for fabric entity placer? also, does this need to go in a minecraft/ subfolder like the dimension JSON?

The entity placer is handled in code, see the example mod.
And yes this also needs to go in minecraft/
